channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Some FEMA staff are put on leave after signing dissent letter
item.description: More than 180 current and former FEMA employees signed the letter sent to the FEMA Review Council and Congress warning that FEMA's capacity to respond...

item.title: A haboob covered central Arizona in dust. But what exactly is it?
item.description: According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, these storms can whip up walls of dust as high as 10,000 feet.

item.title: Protesters occupy Microsoft office as company reviews its work with Israel's military
item.description: Current and former Microsoft employees were among those arrested. Microsoft has said it is reviewing a report that Israel has used its platform to fac...

item.title: Starship's 10th flight breaks streak of bad luck
item.description: After a series of failures during recent test flights, SpaceX's massive Starship had a smooth ride for Tuesday's blast-off, and successfully deployed ...

item.title: Assort Health nabs $50M to automate patient phone calls, sources say
item.description: The company's AI voice agents are designed to take over high-volume, repetitive tasks like scheduling, cancellations, and frequently asked questions n...

item.title: Verily is closing its medical device program as Alphabet shifts more resources to AI
item.description: Alphabet's life sciences arm Verily laid off staff and eliminated its entire devices program as AI and data infrastructure take center stage.

item.title: Microsoft headquarters go into lockdown after activists take over Brad Smith’s office
item.description: The incident is the latest escalation by current and former employees who are demanding the company end its cloud contracts with Israel.

item.title: SpaceX notches major wins during 10th Starship test
item.description: This test marks a material advancement for the Starship program, which SpaceX wants to eventually use to send humans and cargo to Mars.

item.title: Texas company pleads guilty to 2021 construction worker trench death
item.description: An investigation by NPR, Texas Public Radio and 1A in 2024 found that more than 250 workers had died as a result of preventable trench collapses since...

item.title: Anthropic launches a Claude AI agent that lives in Chrome
item.description: Anthropic is the latest AI lab to offer an AI agent with the ability to view and take action in a user's Chrome browser.
